description.narrative: (Uganda): The Regional Health Integration to Enhance Services Activity in Eastern Region (RHITES-E) activity supports 298 maternal, neonatal and child health (MNCH) sites and 298 TB management units in 17 districts. RHITES-E supports implementation of a district-based integrated package of quality MNCH, FP, malaria, HIV/AIDS, TB, Nutrition, and WASH interventions in targeted districts. Three priority areas are: scaling-up implementation of high impact, evidence-based packages; strengthening community level interventions to increase demand and uptake of services; and strengthening the health system to improve services. Major activities include: strengthening healthcare service providers' skills through on-the-job training and mentorship; promote evidence-based decision-making at district, facility and community level; leveraging other health and non-health platforms to increase coverage of services and diversify audiences mainly targeting young people and women groups; strengthening supply chain management to ensure sustainable commodity security; supporting district local governments to ensure effective stewardship, coordination and management of health service delivery; and application of continuous quality improvement approaches for better health outcomes and patient safety. RHITES-E will support communities identify and address structural, social and patient-related barriers to seeking health care. RHITES-E will engage key stakeholders including religious and cultural leaders to create a supportive and enabling environment for quality health care services and better health seeking behaviors for targeted populations. RHITES-E will contribute to furthering self-reliance through its district-based approach and meaningful engagement of all stakeholders and beneficiaries. These two approaches will support communities to identify, plan, finance (where possible) and implement local solutions to their health challenges... ...

title.narrative: Regional Health Integration to Enhance Services in Eastern Region (RHITES-E)
